titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Guide to the Félix Martí-Ibáñez Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:28

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of professional and personal correspondence, manuscripts, articles and essays, research materials, copies of his published works, administrative files of MD Publications and miscellaneous biographical and professional materials. These papers form part of the Contemporary Medical Care and Health Policy Collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Contemporary Medical Care and Health Policy Collection, Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Félix Martí-Ibáñez Papers date from 1935 until 1977 and consist of correspondence, writings, research and teaching material, lectures, photographs, audio tape recordings, and awards of Martí-Ibáñez. Also included are the administrative files of MD Publications.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Félix Martí-Ibáñez (1915-1972): physician, editor; M.D., U. Madrid; general director of public health and social services, Catalonia, Spain, 1937, and then Undersecretary of Public Health and Social Services for Spain; director of wartime health education, Catalonia, 1937-1938; medical director Winthrop Products, Inc., N.Y., 1942-1946, and of E.R. Squibb & Sons, 1946-1950; founded MD Publications in 1950; professor and director of history of medicine department, NY Medical College-Flower Fifth Avenue Hospitals, NY.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Félix Martí-Ibáñez Papers (MS 1235). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the donor of this collection, Verna Sabelle, for materials authored or otherwise produced by Félix Martí-Ibáñez. After the lifetime of the donor, her copyright passes to Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Correspondence from Josefina Martí de Barrera (sister of Martí-Ibáñez) was returned to the donor, June 2003.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Poster, circa 1930s, approximately 39'' x 25'', has photograph of Félix Martí-Ibáñez and advertises "Conferencia es la séptima del ciclo organizado por las Oficinas de Propaganda C.N.T.-F.A.I."

did.unittitle: Letters of Josefina Martí de Barrera; Félix Martí-Ibáñez Album; honors and awards; film footage of William Somerset Maugham shot by Félix and Josephine Martí-Ibáñez at the Villa Mauresque, Cap Ferrat, the Riviera, France; two sets of recordings: "The World of Dr. Martí-Ibáñez," and "Through Time and Space With Dr. Martí-Ibáñez;" text of "The World of Dr. Martí-Ibáñez"

Correspondence with close associates and friends: Maline Asadorian, Betty Hamilton, John W. Hart, Douglas and Violita Macrae, Dr. Gregorio Maran ón, Aída Obler, Hernán Poza Juncal, Verna Sabelle(*), Frank Thompson, Antonia Ruiz Vilaplana, Dr. Alfonso Zamora Samper

odd.head: General note
odd.p: (*)The personal correspondence between Félix Martí-Ibáñez and Verna Sabelle will be turned in at a later date.

did.unittitle: Partial bibliographies; bibliography of Spanish articles by Martí-Ibáñez in boxes 56-67; miscellaneous manuscripts, ideas, speeches, bookplates, projects for television and films; galleys of Waltz , etc.
Travel, interoffice memoranda, various correspondence (most of the related correspondence is in the "General Correspondence" boxes or the "Special Correspondence" boxes)
Published articles and short stories by Martí-Ibáñez

Published articles and short stories by Martí-Ibáñez; reprints of FMI's Editor's Essays published in MD from September, 1971 to December, 1977 (these have not been published as a collection in book form); newspaper articles by Martí-Ibáñez
Various conferences, including the X Congreso International de Historia de la Medicina, held in Toledo Spain, 1935; New York Medical College material
